results.title: The Letter
results.creator_credit: Carolyn Johnson, Anne Delaney and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A visually beautiful film about the pain, fear and courage of the 19th century novelist Fanny Burney, who had her right breast removed without anaesthetic in 1811. It is based on a letter Fanny wrote to her sister some months later. Cast includes Skye Wansey as Fanny Burney and Rachel Blake as the voice of Fanny Burney.
The original letter now resides in the New York Public Library.

results.creator_credit: Paul Gordon, George Moskov and Official Films
results.brief_description: A Franz Liszt recital performed by Polish-American pianist, Jakob Gimpel featuring “Etude Forest murmurs” and “Etude Un Sospiro” (A Sigh).

results.title: The Shot
results.creator_credit: Tim Kreibig, Puven Pather and AFTRS
results.brief_description: After a prolonged career as a war correspondent photographer, Mick thinks he can see through the horror of the environment he works in, until he falls victim to his own convictions! A look into the moral and ethical dilemmas of a war correspondent. Cast features Tony Martin as Mick and mark Lee as Terry.

results.title: One hundred a day
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Alan Marshall and Gillian Armstrong
results.brief_description: In this highly acclaimed short by the director of ‘My Brilliant Career’ (1979) and ‘Oscar and Lucinda’ (1997), a young girl is forced to continue working at her machine all day in a 1930s shoe factory after a visit to a backyard abortionist. Cast features Rosalie Fletcher, Eve Wynne, Jenee Walsh, Beth Child, Virginia Partingale, Sue Piggott. Based on the short story ‘How beautiful are thy feet’ by Alan Marshall. Original format 16mm/black and white.

results.title: Moments in time
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Ron Lowe, South Australian Film Corporation and Film Makers Australia
results.brief_description: Museums are revealed as “time machines”, freezing moments in time so that places and things we couldn’t normally see are made available to us, to look at and to study. Their role in the study of Australian ecology and their other services are also highlighted. Commentary by Steve Curtis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Saunders, Ron Lowe, South Australian Film Corporation and Film Makers Australia

results.title: Jake: today I became a man
results.brief_description: Jake is an extraordinary child who just so happens to love dressing up and performing. His resolution to be himself and carve out an identity for himself regardless of societal expectations is inspiring. A remarkable story told in Jake’s language in which he articulately discusses growing up and his love of singing and performing in drag. An eye opening piece which challenges assumptions of personal identity and that kids do understand themselves and their ‘place’ in the world.

results.title: Jailhouse rock
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Pandro S. Berman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The story of a hard-working young man, jailed for manslaughter, finds an outlet for his frustrations in music, and eventually becomes a rock star. Considered to be Elvis Presley’s best film performance “Jailhouse Rock” features many songs by Jerry Liebler and Mike Stollen, including “Jailhouse Rock”, “Treat Me Nice”, and “Baby I Don’t Care”.

results.title: Relative strangers
results.brief_description:
Simon thought he knew his parents… A film about a family, a deception and its legacy.
The visual effects in this film were all camera-created, using a technique of projection onto a moving sheet to create the insubstantial and constantly changing images that reflect the perceptions of the narrator (Simon Cooper). Nothing in his world turned out to be what it first seemed.
